title: How to add album art in iTunes - Quora

response.answer_text: To add custom album art, you can right click on the song and select “get info”. You can rename the artist, composer, add lyrics, etc. To add album artwork simply select the “artwork” tab and add artwork. This doesn’t just work on music imports from GarageBand or a music software; this can work for any music file in iTunes. Not 100% sure if this works on Windows however, I use a Mac running OS Catalina wit the new Apple Music app.

iTunes can also automatically find the album art for any songs that are also present in the iTunes Store. Select whichever songs for which you would like to download, then select “Get Album Artwork.” I believe you can access this option under either the File menu or the right-hand click menu. I’m also not sure if this option is only available for iTunes Match subscribers or all iTunes users. If not, use the ‘‘Artwork” tab under “Get Info.”
